text: A die-cast toy is any toy produced by the process of die casting. The toys are made of metal with plastic, glass and rubber details. The most common die-cast toys are scale models of vehicles, aircraft and trains. Hot Wheels toys are an example of die-cast cars. Early die-cast toys were made of lead.Sharon M. Scott, Toys and American Culture: An Encyclopedia (Santa Barbara, CA: Greenwood, 2010), p. 73 Modern toys are made of Zamak which is an alloy of zinc, aluminium, magnesium, and copper. == References == == Other websites == * The Making Of AUTOart 1:18 Lamborghini Aventador; YouTube Category:Toys
title: Die-cast toy
